note: Poverty data is expressed in [international-$](#dod:int_dollar_abbreviation) at 2021 prices. Depending on the country and year, it relates to income (measured after taxes and benefits) or to consumption, [per capita](#dod:per-capita).
title: Share in poverty vs. educational attainment
subtitle: Educational attainment is measured as the average number of years of total schooling across all education levels, for the population aged 15-64. The poverty line of $4.20 per day is set by the World Bank to be representative of the definitions of poverty adopted in lower-middle-income countries.

display.name: Share of population living below $4.20 per day
